The most important types of volcanic mountain are "composite cones" or "stratovolcanoes" (Vesuvius, Kilimanjaro and Mount Fuji are examples) and "shield volcanoes" (such as Mauna Loa on Hawaii, a hotspot volcano). A shield volcano has a gently sloping cone due to the low viscosity of the emitted material, primarily basalt. Mauna Loa is the classic example, with a slope of 4°-6°.
